definition: to take by the arm and assist/to mix/to blend/to dilute/to adulterate
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to lend an arm to support sb
to mix/to blend/to dilute
to mix/to mingle/to interfere/to meddle
to dilute/to debase (by mixing with fake material)
to mix (different substances together)/to blend
to mix together/mixture/blend

sentences.english: Objective To research whether pangolin adulterated with magnesium sulfate can goods after lavation.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究搀硫酸镁穿山甲洗涤后是否能作穿山甲入药。

sentences.english: The first angel sounded his trumpet, and there came hail and fire mixed with blood, and it was hurled down upon the earth.
sentences.chinese: 第一位天使吹号，就有雹子与火搀着血丢在地上。

sentences.english: I handed him into his car.
Just then an old man entered, supported by a boy.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时候，一个男孩搀着一位老大爷走了进来。

sentences.english: Steerforth was holding my arm and laughing.
sentences.chinese: 斯提福兹嘻笑着搀着我的胳膊。

sentences.english: Niang favour came forward Chan too madam.
sentences.chinese: 十一娘忙上前搀了太夫人。

sentences.english: Someone had been watering the milk.
After the first trumpet came hail and fire mixed with blood.
sentences.chinese: 第一号带来雹子与火搀着血。

sentences.english: But ignorance, mingled with the human paste, blackens it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在做人的面糊里搀上无知，它便变成黑的。

sentences.english: So I said thanks, I'd have a highball .
sentences.chinese: 我说，谢谢，我有一杯搀姜汁啤酒的威士忌。

sentences.english: Jack hands Cheryl to the bedroom and helps her lie down her back on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 杰克把谢丽尔扶进卧室，搀着她上了床。

sentences.english: He add sand to the soil to make it more porous.
sentences.chinese: 他往土里搀沙子以提高渗水性能。

definition: to lend an arm to support sb
push back/push over
trembling/swaying/flickering/tottering/faltering
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
to grasp firmly
See you!/Bye!
hurriedly/in a frenzy
cannot be used/must not (do sth)/unacceptable
to lead
to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
in a great rush/in a flurry
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
sharp-sighted and deft
